trans-unit.source: TheINSPECTstatement will make a single pass through the sequence of characters comprising the inspect subject. As the pointer to the current inspect target character reaches a point where it falls within the explicit or implicit target ranges specified on the operational instructions of the two clauses, the actions specified by those instructions will become eligible to be taken. As the character pointer reaches a point where it falls past the end of target ranges, the instructions belonging to those target ranges will become disabled.
trans-unit.target: 该 INSPECT 语句将使通过包含所述检查对象的字符序列单程。当指向当前检查目标字符的指针到达这两个子句的操作指令中指定的显式或隐式目标范围内的点时，由这些指令指定的动作将可以执行。当字符指针到达超出目标范围末端的点时，属于那些目标范围的指令将被禁用。

trans-unit.source: TheSTDCALLoption allows system-standard calling conventions (as opposed to GnuCOBOL calling conventions) to be used when calling a subroutine. Use of this requires special knowledge about the linkage requirements of subroutines you are intending toCALL Subroutines written in GnuCOBOL do not need this option.

trans-unit.source: TheUSAGEclause defines the format that will be used to store the value of a data item.
trans-unit.target: 所述 USAGE 子句定义了将被用来存储一个数据项目的值的格式。

trans-unit.source: TheUSAGEspecificationsFLOAT-DECIMAL-16andFLOAT-DECIMAL-34will encode data using IEEE 754Decimal64andDecimal128format, respectively. The former allows for up to 16 digits of exact precision while the latter offers 34. The phrase "exact precision" is used because the traditional binary renderings of decimal real numbers in a floating-point format FLOAT-LONGandFLOAT-SHORT for example) only yield an approximation of the actual value because many decimal fractions cannot be precisely rendered in binary. The Decimal64 and Decimal128 renderings, however, render decimal real numbers in encoded decimal form in much the same way thatPACKED-DECIMALrenders a decimal integer in digit-by-digit decimal form. The exact manner in which this rendering is performed is complex (Wikipedia has an excellent article on the subject  just search forDecimal64.
trans-unit.target: 所述 USAGE 规格 FLOAT-DECIMAL-16 和 FLOAT-DECIMAL-34 将使用IEEE 754编码数据 Decimal64 和 Decimal128 格式分别。前者最多允许16位数字的精确精度，而后者则允许34位精度。之所以使用短语“精确精度”，是因为以浮点格式 FLOAT-LONG 和 FLOAT-SHORT 表示的十进制实数的传统二进制表示形式）只能得出实际值的近似值，因为许多小数部分不能精确地用二进制表示。但是，Decimal64和Decimal128渲染以编码的十进制形式渲染十进制实数，其方式与 PACKED-DECIMAL 几乎相同以逐位十进制形式呈现一个十进制整数。进行渲染的确切方式很复杂（Wikipedia在该主题上有出色的文章–仅搜索 Decimal64 即可。

trans-unit.source: TheUSAGEspecificationsFLOAT-LONGandFLOAT-SHORTuse the IEEE 754Binary64andBinary32formats, respectively. These are binary encodings of real decimal numbers, and as such cannot represent every possible value between the minimum and maximum values in the range for those usages. Wikipedia has an excellent article on the Binary64 and Binary32 encoding schemes  just search onBinary32orBinary64
trans-unit.target: 该 USAGE 规范 FLOAT-LONG 和 FLOAT-SHORT 使用IEEE 754 Binary64 和 Binary32 分别格式。这些是实十进制数字的二进制编码，因此不能表示这些用法范围内的最小值和最大值之间的所有可能值。Wikipedia上有一篇关于Binary64和Binary32编码方案的出色文章–只需在 Binary32 或 Binary64 上搜索

trans-unit.source: There are three possible brightness levels supported for text — lowlight (dim), normal and highlight (bright). The deciding factor as to whether two or three levels are supported lies with the version of the "curses" package that is being used. This is a utility screen-IO package that is included into the GnuCOBOL run-time library when the GnuCOBOL software is built.

trans-unit.source: There may be times where this is exactly what you were looking for. More often than not, however, this is not desirable behaviour. Suggestion: use a copybook to describe the record layouts of any file; this guarantees that multiple programs accessing that file will "see" the same record sizes and layouts by coding aCOPYstatement (see COPY) to import the record layout(s) rather than hand-coding them.

trans-unit.source: There will be multiple structures stored for anINDEXEDfile. The first will be a data component, which may be thought of as being similar to the internal structure of a relative file. Data records may not, however, be directly accessed by their record number as would be the case with a relative file, nor may they be processed sequentially by their physical sequence in the file.
trans-unit.target: INDEXED 文件将存储多个结构。第一个将是数据组件，可以认为它类似于相对文件的内部结构。但是，数据记录不能像相对文件那样直接通过记录号直接访问，也不能通过文件中的物理顺序依次处理。

trans-unit.source: These are alphanumeric literals whose character sequence is specified by hexadecimal value. These literals are formed by a quote- or apostrophe-delimited sequence of an even number of hexadecimal digits (upper- or lower-case), prefixed with the letter "X" (also upper- or lower-case). For example, the character string "Demo" could be specified as the hexadecimal alphanumeric literalX'44656D6F' assuming the ASCII character set. See Alphanumeric Literals.
trans-unit.target: 这些是字母数字文字，其字符序列由十六进制值指定。这些文字由偶数个十六进制数字（大写或小写）加引号或撇号分隔的序列组成，并以字母“ X”（大写或小写）为前缀。例如，可以将字符串“ Demo”指定为十六进制的字母数字文字 X'44656D6F' (假设使用ASCII字符集）。参见字母数字文字。

trans-unit.source: These are data items a COBOL program will be working with. The vast majority of identifiers are defined by the user (programmer) while a few are pre-defined by the GnuCOBOL compiler. Identifiers pre-defined by the compiler are referred to as special registers. Other programming languages generally refer to identifiers as "variables".
trans-unit.target: 这些都是COBOL程序将要处理的数据项。绝大多数标识符是由用户(程序员)定义的,而少数标识符是由GnuCOBOL编译器预先定义的。编译器预先定义的标识符被称为特殊寄存器。其他编程语言一般将标识符称为 "变量"。

trans-unit.source: These are dynamically-loadable object code files ready to be invoked from other programs at execution time. On Windows systems, these would be ".dll" files, while on Unix systems they are typically ".so" files (OSX uses ".dylib").
trans-unit.target: 这些都是可动态加载的对象代码文件,可以在执行时被其他程序调用。在Windows系统中,这些文件是".dll "文件,而在Unix系统中,它们通常是".so "文件(OSX使用".dylib")。

trans-unit.source: These are files with an internal structure similar to that of a line sequential file. These files are defined (without an explicitORGANIZATIONspecification) using theLINE ADVANCINGclause on theirSELECTstatement (see SELECT).
trans-unit.target: 这些文件的内部结构类似于行顺序文件。这些文件是使用其 SELECT 语句上的 LINE ADVANCING 子句定义的（没有明确的 ORGANIZATION 规范）（请参阅SELECT）。

trans-unit.source: These are files with the simplest of all internal structures. Their contents are structured simply as a series of identically- or differently-sized data records, each terminated by a special end-of-record delimiter character. An ASCII line-feed character (hexadecimal 0A) is the end-of-record delimiter character used by any UNIX or pseudo-UNIX (MinGW, Cygwin, OSX) GnuCOBOL build. A truly native Windows build would use a carriage-return, line-feed (hexadecimal 0D0A) sequence.
trans-unit.target: 这些文件具有最简单的内部结构。它们的内容结构很简单,就是一系列相同或不同大小的数据记录,每个记录都由一个特殊的记录末尾定界符结束。ASCII行进位字符(十六进制0A)是任何UNIX或伪UNIX(MinGW、Cygwin、OSX)GnuCOBOL构建中使用的记录结束定界符。真正的原生Windows构建将使用回车、换行(十六进制0D0A)序列。

trans-unit.source: These are subprograms that are coded as the only COBOL program in their Compilation Unit (see Compilation Unit).
trans-unit.target: 这些子程序在其编译单元（请参见编译单元）中被编码为唯一的COBOL程序。

trans-unit.source: These are the ANSI2002 standard specifications for C-program data compatibility and GnuCOBOL programmers should get used to using them when data is being shared with C programs (they’re good documentation too, highlighting the fact that the data will be "shared" with a C program).
trans-unit.target: 这些是用于C程序数据兼容性的ANSI2002标准规范，当与C程序共享数据时，GnuCOBOL程序员应该习惯使用它们（它们也是很好的文档，着重说明了将数据与C程序“共享”的事实。 C程序）。

trans-unit.target: 在所描述的这些参数 PROCEDURE DIVISION USING 子句可各自定义为 BY REFERENCE 如果调用程序要么将它们 BY REFERENCE

trans-unit.source: These arguments must be explicitly included on thePROCEDURE DIVISION USING(see PROCEDURE DIVISION USING) clause that lists the arguments in the sequence in which they will be passed to the subprogram.
trans-unit.target: 这些参数必须明确包含在 PROCEDURE DIVISION USING （请参阅PROCEDURE DIVISION USING）子句中，该子句按顺序将其传递给子程序，列出了这些参数。

trans-unit.source: These commands will create an executable file for the main program -xswitch) and three separate dynamically-loadable libraries -mswitch
trans-unit.target: 这些命令将为主程序 -x 开关和三个独立的可动态加载的库 -m 开关创建一个可执行文件。

trans-unit.source: These default initialization rules can vary quite substantially from one COBOL implementation to another. For example, it is quite common for data division storage to be initialized to all binary zeros except for those data items whereVALUEclauses are present. Take care when working with applications originally developed for another COBOL implementation to ensure that GnuCOBOL’s default initialization rules won’t prove disruptive.
trans-unit.target: 从一个COBOL实现到另一个COBOL实现，这些默认的初始化规则可能会有很大的不同。例如，将数据除法存储初始化为所有二进制零是很常见的，除了那些存在 VALUE 子句的数据项。在使用最初为另一个COBOL实现开发的应用程序时，请务必小心，以确保GnuCOBOL的默认初始化规则不会造成破坏。

trans-unit.source: These devices (they are all synonymous) represent standard system input (pipe 0). On a PC or UNIX system, this is typically the keyboard. The contents of a file may be delivered to a GnuCOBOL program for access via one of these device names by adding the sequence "0< filename" to the end of the programs execution command.
trans-unit.target: 这些设备（它们都是同义词）代表标准系统输入（管道0）。在PC或UNIX系统上，这通常是键盘。通过将序列“ 0 <文件名”添加到程序执行命令的末尾，可以通过这些设备名称之一将文件的内容传递到GnuCOBOL程序进行访问。

trans-unit.source: These devices (they are all synonymous) represent standard system output (pipe 1). On a PC or UNIX system, this is typically the display. Output sent to one of these devices by a GnuCOBOL program can be sent to a file by adding the sequence "1> filename" to the end of the programs execution command.
trans-unit.target: 这些设备（它们都是同义词）代表标准系统输出（管道1）。在PC或UNIX系统上，通常是显示器。通过在程序执行命令的末尾添加序列“ 1> filename”，可以将GnuCOBOL程序发送到这些设备之一的输出发送到文件。

trans-unit.source: These devices (they are synonymous) represent standard system error output (pipe 2). On a PC or UNIX system, this is typically the display. Output sent to one of these devices by a GnuCOBOL program can be sent to a file by adding the sequence "2> filename" to the end of the programs execution command.
trans-unit.target: 这些设备（它们是同义词）代表标准系统错误输出（管道2）。在PC或UNIX系统上，通常是显示器。通过在程序执行命令的末尾添加序列“ 2> filename”，可以将GnuCOBOL程序发送到这些设备之一的输出发送到文件。

trans-unit.source: These disk files will be automatically purged uponSORTorMERGEtermination. They will also be purged if the program terminates abnormally before theSORTorMERGEfinishes. Should you ever need to know, temporary sort/merge work files will be named "cob*.tmp".
trans-unit.target: 这些磁盘文件将在 SORT 或 MERGE 终止时自动清除。如果程序在 SORT 或 MERGE 完成之前异常终止，它们也将被清除。如果您需要知道，临时的排序/合并工作文件将被命名为“ cob * .tmp”。

trans-unit.target: 这些编辑符号被称为浮动替换符号。这些符号可能出现在以下序列中

trans-unit.source: These environment variables have default values established for them when the version of GnuCOBOL you are using was built. To see these default values, as well as other build-specific information, execute the command:
trans-unit.target: 这些环境变量的默认值是在你使用的GnuCOBOL版本构建时为它们建立的。要查看这些默认值,以及其他特定的构建信息,请执行命令。

trans-unit.source: These features allow fields to be displayed at specific row/column positions, various colors and video attributes to be assigned to screen fields and the pressing of specific function keys (F1, F2, …) to be detectable. All of this takes place through the auspices of theSCREEN SECTION(see SCREEN SECTION) and special formats of theACCEPTstatement (see ACCEPT) and theDISPLAYstatement (see DISPLAY).
trans-unit.target: 这些功能允许将字段显示在特定的行/列位置，将各种颜色和视频属性分配给屏幕字段，并且可以检测到特定功能键（F1，F2等）的按下。所有这些都是通过 SCREEN SECTION （请参阅SCREEN SECTION）以及 ACCEPT 语句（请参阅ACCEPT）和 DISPLAY 语句（请参见DISPLAY）的特殊格式进行的。

trans-unit.source: These files
trans-unit.target: 这些文件

trans-unit.source: These files also have a simple internal structure. Their contents are structured simply as an arbitrarily-long sequence of data characters. This sequence of characters will be treated as a series of fixed-length records simply by logically splitting the sequence of characters up into fixed-length segments, each as long as the maximum record size defined in the program. There are no special end-of-record delimiter characters in the file and when the file is written to by a GnuCOBOL program, no delimiter sequence is appended to the data.
trans-unit.target: 这些文件的内部结构也很简单。它们的内容结构简单,是一个任意长的数据字符序列。这个字符序列将被视为一系列固定长度的记录,只需将字符序列逻辑地分割成固定长度的段,每个段的长度与程序中定义的最大记录大小相同。文件中没有特殊的记录结束定界符,当GnuCOBOL程序将文件写入时,不会将定界符序列附加到数据上。

trans-unit.source: These files can contain exact binary data fields. The contents of record fields are irrelevant to the reading process as there is no end-of-record delimiter.
trans-unit.target: 这些文件可以包含精确的二进制数据字段。记录字段的内容与读取过程无关,因为没有记录结束的定界符。

trans-unit.source: These files cannot be prepared with any standard text-editing or word processing software as all such programs will embed delimiter characters at the end of records (useORGANIZATION IS LINE SEQUENTIALinstead).
trans-unit.target: 这些文件无法使用任何标准的文本编辑或文字处理软件进行准备，因为所有此类程序都会在记录的末尾嵌入定界符（请改用 ORGANIZATION IS LINE SEQUENTIAL ）。

trans-unit.source: These files may be created with any standard text-editing or word processing software capable of writing text files. Such files should not contain anyUSAGE COMPUTATIONALorBINARY(of any variety) data since such fields could accidentally contain byte sequences that could be interpreted as an end-of-record delimiter.
trans-unit.target: 这些文件可以使用任何能够编写文本文件的标准文本编辑或文字处理软件来创建。此类文件不应包含任何 USAGE COMPUTATIONAL 或 BINARY （任何种类的）数据，因为此类字段可能偶然包含可被解释为记录结束定界符的字节序列。

trans-unit.source: These files may contain eitherUSAGE DISPLAYorUSAGE COMPUTATIONAL(of any variety) data since no binary data sequence can be accidentally interpreted as an end-of-record delimiter.
trans-unit.target: 这些文件可能包含“ USAGE DISPLAY 或“ USAGE COMPUTATIONAL （任何种类）数据，因为没有任何二进制数据序列可以被意外地解释为记录结束定界符。

trans-unit.source: These files should not be defined to contain any exact binary data fields because the contents of those fields could inadvertently have the end-of-record sequence as part of their values — this would confuse the runtime system when reading the file, and it would interpret that value as an actual end-of-record sequence.
trans-unit.target: 这些文件不应定义为包含任何确切的二进制数据字段，因为这些字段的内容可能会无意中将记录结束序列作为其值的一部分-这会在读取文件时混淆运行时系统，并且会解释该值作为实际的记录结束序列。

trans-unit.source: These groups will be presented (printed) across however many formatted pages are necessary to hold them. No single report group will be allowed to cross page boundaries.
trans-unit.target: 这些报告组将在必要的格式化页面上显示(打印),以容纳它们。任何一个报告组都不允许跨越页面边界。

trans-unit.source: These options (which are synonymous) inform GnuCOBOL that any locks held by other programs should be ignored.
trans-unit.target: 这些选项(是同义词)通知GnuCOBOL应该忽略其他程序持有的任何锁。

trans-unit.target: 这些程序的编译和执行如下。

trans-unit.target: 这些部分包括一系列特定的，预定义的段落（例如， SOURCE-COMPUTER 和 OBJECT-COMPUTER ），每个段落都有特定的用途。如果出于以下任一目的而无需代码，则可以省略整个段落。

trans-unit.source: They conform to the principles of Object-Oriented Programming (OOP). This is desired for one major reason — it facilitates "code re-usability", thus improving the productivity of programmers by allowing them to re-use previously written (and debugged) code in new applications. For one reason or another, COBOL is perceived as being weak in this regard. It isn’t (especially today), as we’ll see in the next section, but perception is important.
trans-unit.target: 它们符合面向对象编程（OOP）的原理。之所以需要这样做是出于一个主要原因-它促进了“代码的可重用性”，从而通过允许程序员在新的应用程序中重用先前编写（和调试）的代码来提高程序员的生产率。由于一个或另一个原因，在这方面，COBOL被认为是薄弱的。并非如此（特别是在今天），正如我们将在下一部分中看到的那样，但是感知很重要。

Consider defining "numeric" command line arguments asPIC Xand then using theNUMVALintrinsic function (see NUMVAL) function to determine the proper numeric value.
trans-unit.target: 当参数定义为 PIC 9 时，此行为可能是不可接受的，因为定义为 PIC 9(3) 但从命令行传递了值“ 1”的参数将收到值“ 100”，而不是“ 001” 。考虑将“数字”命令行参数定义为 PIC X ，然后使用 NUMVAL 内在函数（请参见NUMVAL）确定适当的数值。

trans-unit.source: This clause is used to specify either the data item a screen section field is to obtain it’s value from when the screen is displayed, or a literal that will specify the value of that same field.
trans-unit.target: 此子句用于指定屏幕截面字段要从显示屏幕时获取其值的数据项，或用于指定同一字段值的文字。

trans-unit.source: This clause is used to specify the color of text within a screen data item or the default text color of subordinate items if used on a group item.

trans-unit.source: This clause is used to specify the screen background color of the screen data item or the default screen background color of subordinate items if used on a group item.
trans-unit.target: 此子句用于指定屏幕数据项的屏幕背景色,如果在组项目上使用,则指定下级项目的默认屏幕背景色。

trans-unit.source: This clause is useful when one screen section item is being displayed over the top of a previously-displayed one.

trans-unit.source: This file organization was defined to accommodate either sequential or random processing. With aRELATIVEfile, it is possible to read or write record 100 directly, without having to have first read or written records 1-99. The GnuCOBOL runtime system uses the program-defined maximum record size to calculate a relative byte position in the file where the record header and data begin, and then transfers the necessary data to or from the program.
trans-unit.target: 定义此文件组织以适应顺序或随机处理。使用 RELATIVE 文件，可以直接读取或写入记录100，而不必先读取或写入记录1-99。GnuCOBOL运行时系统使用程序定义的最大记录大小来计算文件中记录头和数据开始的相对字节位置，然后将必要的数据传输到程序中或从程序中传输出必要的数据。

trans-unit.source: This is a single subprogram compiled into object-code form, ready to be linked in with a main program to form a directly-executable program. On windows computers, these generally are ".o" (object-code) files.

trans-unit.source: This is an executable file directly-executable from the command-line. On Windows computers, this would be an ".exe" file. On Unix systems, this will be a file with no specific extension, but with execute permissions. This file will include the main program as well as any static-linked subprograms.
trans-unit.target: 这是一个可直接从命令行执行的可执行文件。在Windows电脑上,这将是一个".exe "文件。在Unix系统中,这将是一个没有特定扩展名,但有执行权限的文件。这个文件将包括主程序以及任何静态链接的子程序。

trans-unit.source: This is another obsolete area of COBOL statements. This part of every statement also hails back to the day when programs were punched on cards; it was expected that the name of the program (or at least the first 8 characters of it) would be punched here so that — if a dropped COBOL source deck contained more than one program — that handy card sorter machine could be used to first separate the cards by program name and then sort them by sequence number. Today’s COBOL compilers (including GnuCOBOL) simply ignore anything past column 72.
trans-unit.target: 这是COBOL语句的另一个过时区域。每个语句的这一部分还可以追溯到在卡片上打孔程序的那一天。可以预期在此处打上程序的名称（或至少程序的前8个字符），以便-如果放下的COBOL源代码甲板包含多个程序，则可以使用该便携式卡分类器首先进行分离按程序名称对卡片进行排序，然后按序列号对卡片进行排序。当今的COBOL编译器（包括GnuCOBOL）仅忽略第72列之后的所有内容。

trans-unit.source: This section contains an example of the RWCS at work. The complete program, presented here, is a stripped-down version of a program I have used to generate a report for a class I teach on PC hardware. This report will provide benchmark statistics on a variety of popular AMD and Intel CPUs. The data for the report was obtained from the website www.cpubenchmark.net in December of 2013. By the time you are reading this, that data will most likely have become rather out-of-date, but it illustrates RWCS well enough.

trans-unit.source: This symbol is coded as the two characters "C" and "R". If the value of the numeric value moved into the field is positive (0 or greater), two spaces will be inserted. If the value is negative (less than 0), the characters "CR" (credit) are inserted.
trans-unit.target: 这个符号被编码为两个字符 "C "和 "R"。如果移入字段的数值为正值(0或更大),将插入两个空格。如果数值为负值(小于0),则插入 "CR"(信用)字符。

trans-unit.source: This symbol is coded as the two characters "D" and "B". If the value of the numeric value moved into the field is positive (0 or greater), two spaces will be inserted. If the value is negative (less than 0), the characters "DB" (debit) are inserted.
trans-unit.target: 该符号的编码为 "D "和 "B "两个字符。如果移入字段的数值为正值(0或更大),将插入两个空格。如果数值为负值(小于0),则插入 "DB"(借方)字符。

trans-unit.source: This symbol is referred to as a check protection symbol. All check-protection symbols that correspond to character positions in which leading zeros reside will have their "0" values replaced by "*".
trans-unit.target: 这个符号被称为校验保护符号。所有与前导零所在的字符位置相对应的校验保护符号,其 "0 "值将被 "*"代替。

trans-unit.source: This symbol is used to define where an implied decimal-point (if any) is located in a numeric item. Just as there may only be a single decimal point in a number so may there be no more than oneVin aPICTURE Implied decimal points occupy no space in storage — they just specify how values are used. For example, if the value1234is in storage in a field defined as PIC 999V9, that value would be treated as 123.4 in any statements that referenced it.
trans-unit.target: 该符号用于定义隐式小数点（如果有）在数字项中的位置。正如有可能只是一些单个小数点，可能会有不超过一个 V 在 PICTURE 隐含小数点占用的存储空间没有-他们只是指定的值是如何使用的。例如，如果值 1234 存储在定义为PIC 999V9的字段中，则在引用该值的任何语句中该值将被视为123.4。

trans-unit.source: This symbol, if used, must be the very first symbol in thePICTUREvalue. ASindicates that the data item isSigned meaning that negative values are possible for this data item. Without anS any negative values stored into this data item via aMOVEor arithmetic statement will have the negative sign stripped from it (in effect becoming the absolute value).
trans-unit.target: 如果使用此符号，则它必须是 PICTURE 值中的第一个符号。甲 S 表示该数据项被 Signed 的意思是负值也是可能的该数据项。如果没有 S ,则任何通过 MOVE 或算术语句存储到此数据项中的负值都将去除负号（实际上成为绝对值）。

trans-unit.source: This too is a video feature that is dependent upon the "curses" package built into your version of GnuCOBOL. If blinking is enabled in that package, text displayed in fields defined in the screen section as being blinking will endlessly cycle between the brightest possible setting (highlight) and an "invisible" setting where the text color matches that of the field background color. A Windows build, which generally uses the "pcurses" package, will uses a brighter-than-normal background color to signify "blinking".
trans-unit.target: 这也是一个视频功能,它依赖于你的GnuCOBOL版本中内置的 "curses "包。如果在该包中启用了闪烁功能,那么在屏幕部分定义为闪烁的字段中显示的文本将在最亮的设置(高亮)和 "不可见 "设置(文本颜色与字段背景颜色一致)之间无休止地循环。一般使用 "pcurses "包的Windows构建,将使用比正常背景色更亮的颜色来表示 "闪烁"。

trans-unit.source: Those that argue that it is too boring / wasteful / time-consuming / insulting (pick one) to have to code a COBOL program "from scratch" are clearly ignorant of the following facts:
trans-unit.target: 那些认为 "从头开始 "编写COBOL程序太无聊/浪费/耗时/侮辱人(选一个)的人,显然对以下事实一无所知。

trans-unit.source: Through theCALLstatement, COBOL programs may invoke other COBOL programs serving as subprograms. This is quite similar to cross-program linkage capabilities provided by other languages. In GnuCOBOL’s case, theCALLfacility is powerful enough to be tailored to the point where a GnuCOBOL program can communicate with operating system, database management and run-time library APIs, even if they weren’t written in COBOL themselves. See GnuCOBOL Main Programs CALLing C Subprograms, for an example of how a GnuCOBOL program could invoke a C-language subprogram, passing information back and forth between the two.
trans-unit.target: 通过 CALL 语句，COBOL程序可以调用用作子程序的其他COBOL程序。这与其他语言提供的跨程序链接功能非常相似。在GnuCOBOL的情况下， CALL 功能足够强大，可以定制为GnuCOBOL程序可以与操作系统，数据库管理和运行时库API进行通信的点，即使它们本身不是用COBOL编写的。有关GnuCOBOL程序如何调用C语言子程序，在两个子程序之间来回传递信息的示例，请参见GnuCOBOL主程序调用C子程序。

trans-unit.source: To avoid any possible ambiguity, as well as to improve program readability, it’s considered good COBOL programming practice to always code at least one space to both the left and right of every operator in arithmetic expressions as well as the=sign on a COMPUTE.
trans-unit.target: 为了避免任何歧义并提高程序的可读性，在COBOL编程实践中，始终在算术表达式中的每个运算符的左侧和右侧都至少编码一个空格，以及在COMPUTE上使用 = 符号，这被认为是一种良好的COBOL编程实践。

trans-unit.source: Today’s IT managers and business leaders are faced with a challenging dilemma — how do you maintain the enormous COBOL code base that is still running their businesses when academia has all but abandoned the language they need their people to use to keep the wheels rolling? The problem is compounded by the fact that those programmers that are skilled in COBOL are retiring and taking their knowledge with them. In some markets, this appears to be having an inflationary effect on the cost of resources (COBOL programmers) whose supply is becoming smaller and smaller. The pressure to update applications to make use of more up-to-date graphical user interfaces is also perceived as a reason to abandon COBOL in favour of GUI-friendly languages such as Java.
trans-unit.target: 当今的IT经理和业务领导者面临着一个充满挑战的难题–当学术界几乎放弃了他们需要的人员使用的语言以保持运转时，如何维护仍在运行其业务的庞大COBOL代码库？问题在于，那些精通COBOL的程序员正在退休并与他们一起获取知识，这一事实使问题更加复杂。在某些市场中，这似乎对资源成本（COBOL程序员）的通货膨胀产生了影响，这些资源的供给越来越小。人们也认为，更新应用程序以使用最新的图形用户界面的压力是放弃COBOL而是转而使用GUI友好的语言（例如Java）的原因。

trans-unit.source: Today’s current programming languages have a statement (usually, this statement is named "import", "include" or "#include") that performs this same function. What makes the COBOL copybook feature different than the "include" facility in newer languages, however, is the fact that theCOPYstatement can edit the imported source code as it is being copied. This capability makes copybook libraries extremely valuable to making code reusable.
trans-unit.target: 当今的当前编程语言具有执行相同功能的语句（通常，该语句名为“ import”，“ include”或“ #include”）。但是，使COBOL抄写本功能与更新语言中的“ include”功能有所不同的原因是， COPY 语句可以在复制导入的源代码时对其进行编辑。此功能使抄写本库对于使代码可重用非常有价值。

trans-unit.source: Training their own COBOL programmers. Since colleges, universities and technical schools have lost interest in doing so, many businesses have undertaken the task of "growing their own" new crop of COBOL programmers. Fear of being pigeon-holed into a niche technology is a factor inhibiting many of today’s programmers from willingly volunteering for such training.
trans-unit.target: 培训自己的COBOL程序员。由于学院，大学和技术学校对此失去了兴趣，因此许多企业承担了“种植自己的”新型COBOL程序员的任务。害怕被鸽子打入利基技术，这是阻碍当今许多程序员自愿自愿参加此类培训的一个因素。

trans-unit.source: Unlike theWHEN-COMPILEDspecial register, which has an ASCII value of the compilation date/time in the format "mm/dd/yyhh.mm.ss", theWHEN-COMPILEDintrinsic function returns the compilation date/time as an ASCII string in the format "yyyymmddhhmmssnnooooo", where "yyyymmdd" is the date, "hhmmss" is the time, "nn" is the hundredths of a second component of the compilation time, if available (or "00" if it isn’t) and "ooooo" is the time zone offset from GMT.
trans-unit.target: 与 WHEN-COMPILED 特殊寄存器不同，后者的编译日期/时间的ASCII值格式为“ mm / dd / yyhh.mm.ss”， WHEN-COMPILED 固有函数将编译日期/时间作为ASCII字符串返回。格式为“ yyyymmddhhmmssnnooooo”，其中“ yyyymmdd”为日期，“ hhmmss”为时间，“ nn”为编译时间的第二个分量的百分之一（如果有）（如果没有，则为“ 00”）而“ ooooo”是相对格林尼治标准时间的时区偏移量。

trans-unit.source: Upon completion, theRETURN-CODEspecial register (see Special Registers) will be set to 0 if the write was successful or to 30 if an I/O error condition occurred. If a value of -1 is returned, a problem was identified with the subroutine arguments.

trans-unit.source: When a GnuCOBOL program is executed from a command-line, the complete command line text will be broken into a series of "tokens", where each token is identified as being a word separated from the others in the command text by at least one space. For example, if the command line was /usr/local/myprog THIS IS A TEST, there will be five tokens identified by the operating system — "/usr/local/myprog", "THIS", "IS", "A" and "TEST".
trans-unit.target: 当从命令行执行GnuCOBOL程序时，完整的命令行文本将分为一系列“令牌”，其中每个令牌被标识为与命令文本中的其他单词隔开至少一个空格的单词。 。例如，如果命令行为 /usr/local/myprog THIS IS A TEST ，则操作系统将识别出五个令牌-“ / usr / local / myprog”，“ THIS”，“ IS”，“ A”和“测试”。

trans-unit.source: When coding a GnuCOBOL subprogram (a subroutine or user-defined function), all arguments to the subprogram must be defined in the subprogram’s linkage section.

trans-unit.source: When comparing one numeric value to another, theUSAGE(see USAGE) and number of significant digits in either value are irrelevant as the comparison is performed using the actual algebraic values.
trans-unit.target: 将一个数字值与另一个数字值进行比较时， USAGE （请参阅USAGE）和两个值中的有效位数无关，因为使用实际的代数值进行比较。

trans-unit.source: When comparing strings, the comparison is made based upon the program’s collating sequence. When the two string arguments are of unequal length, the shorter is assumed to be padded (on the right) with a sufficient number of spaces as to make the two strings of equal length. String comparisons take place on a corresponding character-by-character basis, left to right, until the TRUE/FALSE value for the relation test can be established. Characters are compared according to their relative position in the program’sCOLLATING SEQUENCE(as defined inSPECIAL-NAMES(see SPECIAL-NAMES)),
trans-unit.target: 比较字符串时，将根据程序的整理顺序进行比较。当两个字符串参数的长度不相等时，假定较短的字符串被填充（在右侧）并带有足够的空格，以使两个字符串的长度相等。字符串比较是从左到右在逐个字符的基础上进行的，直到可以为关系测试确定TRUE / FALSE值为止。根据字符在程序的 COLLATING SEQUENCE （如 SPECIAL-NAMES （请参阅SPECIAL-NAMES）中定义）的相对位置比较字符，

trans-unit.source: When corresponding matches are established, the effect of aMOVE CORRESPONDINGon those matches will be as if a series of individualMOVE were done — one for each match.
trans-unit.target: 建立相应的匹配后， MOVE CORRESPONDING 对那些匹配的影响就好像完成了一系列单独的 MOVE －每个匹配一个。

trans-unit.source: When describing a report via theRD(see REPORT SECTION) clause, the total number of usable lines are specified as thePAGE LIMITvalue; this value is the sum of the number of lines contained in the Heading, Body and Footing Areas.
trans-unit.target: 通过 RD （请参阅REPORT SECTION）子句描述报告时，可用行的总数指定为 PAGE LIMIT 值；此值是“标题”，“正文”和“基础”区域中包含的行数的总和。

trans-unit.source: When describing data hierarchies, you may never use a level number greater than 49 (except for 66, 77, 78 and 88 which have very special meanings — see see Special Data Items).
trans-unit.target: 在描述数据层次结构时，您永远不能使用大于49的级别数字（66、77、78和88除外，它们具有非常特殊的含义-请参阅“ 特殊数据项”）。

Take for example, the following code written in FORTRAN — a language developed only a year before COBOL:

trans-unit.source: When multiple programs occur in a source file, it is assumed that the programs are related to one another in that they will be CALLed or executed as functions from the others.
trans-unit.target: 当在一个源文件中出现多个程序时,假定这些程序是相互关联的,它们将作为其他程序的函数被调用或执行。

trans-unit.source: When only a portion of a reserved word is underlined, it indicates that the word may either be coded in its full form or may be abbreviated to the portion that is underlined.
trans-unit.target: 当一个保留的单词只有一部分被下划线时,它表示该单词可以以其完整的形式编码,也可以是被下划线部分的缩写。

trans-unit.source: When programs get very large, it becomes more and more challenging to keep track of the data items that will be used in the program. Here, in no particular order of importance, are a variety of conventions that can simply that problem.
trans-unit.target: 当程序变得非常大的时候,要跟踪程序中会用到的数据项就变得越来越有挑战性。在这里,没有特别重要的顺序,是各种惯例,可以简单地解决这个问题。

trans-unit.source: When reading aLINE SEQUENTIALfile, records in excess of the size implied by the file’s description in theFILE SECTIONwill be truncated while records shorter than that size will be padded to the right withSPACES
trans-unit.target: 当读取一个 LINE SEQUENTIAL 文件，超过由文件的描述中隐含的长度记录的 FILE SECTION 将被截去，而比尺寸更短的记录将被补上了合适的 SPACES

trans-unit.source: When reading any sequential (any organization) or relative file, the "next" direction refers to the physical sequence of records in the file. When reading an indexed file, the "next" and "previous" directions refer to the sequence of primary or alternate record key values in the file’s records, regardless of where the records physically occur within the file.
trans-unit.target: 当读取任何顺序的（任何组织）或相对文件时，“下一个”方向是指文件中记录的物理顺序。读取索引文件时，“下一个”和“上一个”方向是指文件记录中主记录或备用记录键值的顺序，无论记录在文件中实际出现在何处。

trans-unit.source: When reserved words appear without underlining, as this one is, they are optional; such reserved words are available in the language syntax merely to improve readability — their presence or absence has no effect upon the program.
trans-unit.target: 当保留字没有下划线出现时，这是可选的；这样的保留字仅在语言语法中可用以提高可读性-它们的存在或不存在对程序没有影响。

trans-unit.source: When searching a table with "n" entries, a binary search will need a worst-case of log2(n) tests in order to find an entry and log2(n) tests to identify that an entry doesn’t exist (n = the number of entries in the table), where "log2" is the base-2 logarithm function.
trans-unit.target: 当搜索具有“ n”个条目的表时，二进制搜索将需要最坏情况的log2（n）测试才能找到条目，而log2（n）测试则需要识别不存在的条目（n =表中的条目数），其中“ log2”是以2为底的对数函数。

trans-unit.source: When searching a table with "n" entries, a sequential search will need an average of n/2 tests and a worst case of n tests in order to find an entry and n tests to identify that an entry doesn’t exist.
trans-unit.target: 当搜索具有“ n”个条目的表时，顺序搜索将需要平均n / 2个测试和最坏情况的n个测试才能找到一个条目，并需要n个测试来标识一个条目不存在。

trans-unit.source: When single record locking is in-effect, as a new record is accessed, locks held for previous records are released. By using this option, not only is the newly-accessed record locked (as WITH LOCK would do), but prior record locks will be retained as well. A subsequentREADwithout theKEPT LOCKoption will release all "kept" locks, as will theUNLOCKstatement.
trans-unit.target: 当单个记录锁定生效时，随着访问新记录，将释放为先前记录保留的锁。通过使用此选项，不仅新访问的记录将被锁定（如WITH LOCK那样），而且先前的记录锁定也将被保留。没有 KEPT LOCK 选项的后续 READ 将释放所有“保留的”锁定， UNLOCK 语句也将释放。

trans-unit.source: When specifyingFALSE the value assigned to each parent data item will be the value specified for theFALSEclause of the condition name’s definition; if any <
trans-unit.target: 当指定 FALSE 时，分配给每个父数据项的值将是为条件名称的定义的 FALSE 子句指定的值。如果有的话<

trans-unit.source: When specifyingTRUE the value assigned to each parent data item will be the first value specified on the condition name’sVALUEclause.
trans-unit.target: 如果指定 TRUE ,则分配给每个父数据项的值将是在条件名称的 VALUE 子句中指定的第一个值。

trans-unit.source: When the <
trans-unit.target: 当<

trans-unit.source: When the ’Enter’ key is pressed.
trans-unit.target: 当按下“ Enter”键时。

trans-unit.source: When the character set in use is ASCII with no collating sequence modifications, theLOW-VALUESfigurative constant value is the ASCII "NUL" character. Because character sets can be redefined, however, you should not rely on this fact — use theNULLfigurative constant instead.
trans-unit.target: 当使用的字符集是ASCII且没有排序顺序修改时， LOW-VALUES 图形常量是ASCII“ NUL”字符。但是，由于可以重新定义字符集，因此您不应该依赖这个事实，而应使用 NULL 图形常量。

trans-unit.source: When the compiler is operating in Fixed Format Mode, all CDF statements must begin in column eight (8) or beyond.
trans-unit.target: 当编译器在固定格式模式下运行时,所有的CDF语句必须从第8列(8)或以后开始。

trans-unit.source: When the console is running in a windowed environment, this will be the sizing of the window in which the program is executing, in terms of horizontal COLUMNS or vertical LINES character counts — not pixels.
trans-unit.target: 当控制台在窗口环境中运行，这将是其在程序执行窗口的大小，在水平方面 COLUMNS 或垂直 LINES 字符计数-而不是像素。

trans-unit.source: When the end of the currently-compiling source file is reached, Replace Mode is deactivated and any stacked replace specifications will be discarded — compilation of the next source file (if any) will begin with Replace Mode inactive and no change specification(s) on the stack.
trans-unit.target: 当到达当前正在编译的源文件的末尾时，替换模式将被停用，所有堆叠的替换规范都将被丢弃-下一个源文件（如果有）的编译将以“替换模式”处于非活动状态开始，并且没有更改规范堆栈。

trans-unit.source: When the file is read, the GnuCOBOL runtime system will strip the trailing delimiter sequence from each record. The data will be padded (on the right) with spaces if the data just read is shorter than the area described for data records in the program. If the data is too long, it will be truncated and the excess will be lost.
trans-unit.target: 读取文件时,GnuCOBOL运行时系统将从每条记录中剥离尾部定界符序列。如果刚刚读取的数据比程序中数据记录所描述的区域短,那么数据将用空格来填充(在右边)。如果数据太长,则会被截断,多余的数据将丢失。

trans-unit.source: When the file is read, the data is transferred into the program exactly as it exists in the file.
trans-unit.target: 读取文件时,数据会完全按照文件中存在的数据传输到程序中。

trans-unit.source: When the file is read, the data is transferred into the program exactly as it exists in the file. In the event that a short record is read as the very last record, that record will be padded (to the right) with spaces.
trans-unit.target: 当文件被读取时,数据被完全按照文件中的内容传输到程序中。如果一条短记录作为最后一条记录被读取,该记录将用空格填充(向右)。

trans-unit.source: When the file is written by a GnuCOBOL program, no delimiter sequence is appended to the data, but a record-length field is added to the beginning of each physical record.
trans-unit.target: 当文件由GnuCOBOL程序写入时,数据中不附加任何定界符序列,但每个物理记录的开头都会添加一个记录长度字段。

trans-unit.source: When the file is written to by a GnuCOBOL program, the delimiter sequence will be automatically appended to each data record as it is written to the file. AWRITE(see WRITE) to this type of file will be done as if aBEFORE ADVANCING 1 LINEclause were specified on theWRITE if noADVANCINGclause is coded.
trans-unit.target: 当文件由GnuCOBOL程序写入时，定界符序列将在写入到文件时自动附加到每个数据记录。如果未编码 ADVANCING 子句，则将执行对此类文件的 WRITE （请参阅WRITE），就好像在 WRITE 上指定了 BEFORE ADVANCING 1 LINE 子句一样。

trans-unit.target: 当执行报表的第一个 GENERATE 语句时，将保存所有控制字段的内容，以便在后续 GENERATE 语句的处理过程中可以引用它们。

trans-unit.source: When the system is not running a windowing environment, the physical console screen attributes will be returned.

trans-unit.source: When the system is running in a windowed environment, this will be the sizing of the console window in which the program is executing. When the system is not running a windowing environment, the physical console screen attributes will be returned. In environments such as a Windows console window, where the logical size of the window may far exceed that of the physical console window, the size returned will be that of the physical console window. Two one-byte values will be returned — the first will be the current number of lines (rows) while the second will be the number of columns.
trans-unit.target: 当系统在窗口环境中运行时，这将是执行程序的控制台窗口的大小。当系统未运行窗口环境时，将返回物理控制台屏幕属性。在Windows控制台窗口等环境中，该窗口的逻辑大小可能远远超过物理控制台窗口的逻辑大小，返回的大小将是物理控制台窗口的大小。将返回两个一个字节的值-第一个将是当前行数（行），而第二个将是列数。

trans-unit.source: When your program opens a file with this sharing option in effect, no restrictions will be placed on other programs attempting toOPENthe file after your program did. This is the default sharing mode.

trans-unit.source: When your program opens a file with this sharing option in effect, your program announces that it is unwilling to allow any other program to have any access to the file as long as you are using that file;OPENattempts made in other programs will fail with a file status of 37 ("PERMISSION DENIED") until such time as youCLOSE(see CLOSE) the file.
trans-unit.target: 当您的程序打开一个带有此共享选项的文件时，您的程序便宣布不愿意任何其他程序访问该文件，只要您正在使用该文件即可。在其他程序中进行的 OPEN 尝试将失败，并且文件状态为37（“ PERMISSION DENIED”），直到您 CLOSE （请参阅CLOSE）该文件。

trans-unit.source: While GnuCOBOL supports few of the OOP programming constructs defined by the COBOL2002 and COBOL20xx standards, it supports every aspect of the ANSI 85 standard and therefore fully meets the needs of points #1 and #2, above. With it’s supported feature set (see So What is GnuCOBOL?), it provides significant programmer productivity capabilities.
trans-unit.target: 尽管GnuCOBOL支持由COBOL2002和COBOL20xx标准定义的几种OOP编程结构，但它支持ANSI 85标准的各个方面，因此完全满足上述第1点和第2点的需求。凭借其受支持的功能集（请参阅GnuCOBOL是什么？），它提供了重要的程序员生产力功能。

trans-unit.source: While anORGANIZATION RELATIVEfile may be defined as having variable-length records, the file will be structured in such a manner as to reserve space for each record equal to the size of the largest possible record as defined by the file’s description in theFILE SECTION
trans-unit.target: 虽然可以将 ORGANIZATION RELATIVE 文件定义为具有可变长度的记录，但是文件的结构将为每个记录保留等于 FILE SECTION 文件描述所定义的最大可能记录大小的空间。

trans-unit.source: While any COBOL implementation’s sort or merge facilities guarantee that records with duplicate key values will be in proper sequence with regard to other records with different key values, they generally make no promises as to the resulting relative sequence of records having duplicate key values with one another.
trans-unit.target: 尽管任何COBOL实现的排序或合并工具都保证具有重复键值的记录将相对于具有不同键值的其他记录按适当的顺序排列，但是它们通常不保证最终结果具有相互重复键值的记录的相对顺序。

trans-unit.source: With a binary search, express the number of entries as a binary number (1,000 = 1111101000), count the number of digits in the result (which is, essentially, what a logarithm is, when rounded up to the next integer — the number of digits a decimal number would have if expressed in the logarithm’s number base). In this case, we end up with 10 — THAT is the worst-case number of tests required to find an entry or to identify that it doesn’t exist. That’s quite an improvement!
trans-unit.target: 使用二进制搜索时，将条目数表示为二进制数（1,000 = 1111101000），计算结果中的位数（从本质上讲，它是对数值，四舍五入到下一个整数时，即-如果以对数的数字基数表示，则十进制数字将具有十进制数字）。在这种情况下，我们最终得到10个-这是找到条目或识别条目不存在所需的最坏情况的测试数。这是一个很大的进步！

trans-unit.source: With its original limitation on the length of variable names (one- to six-character names comprised of a letter followed by up to five letters and/or digits), it’s implicit rule that variable were automatically created as real (floating-point) unless their name started with a letter in the range I-N, and its use of algebraic notation to express actions being taken, FORTRAN wasn’t a particularly readable language, even for programmers. Compare this with the equivalent COBOL code:
trans-unit.target: 由于其最初对变量名长度的限制（一到六个字符的名称，由一个字母和最多五个字母和/或数字组成），隐含的规则是，除非将变量自动创建为实数（浮点数），否则它们的名称以IN范围内的字母开头，并且使用代数符号表示所采取的动作，即使对于程序员而言，FORTRAN也不是一种特别易读的语言。将此与等效的COBOL代码进行比较：

trans-unit.source: With the above example, if the inspect subject were--ABCDEF----BCDEF-- the final result of the counting would be that C-ABC would be incremented by 1 while C-BCDE would be incremented only once; although the human eye clearly sees two "BCDE" sequences, theINSPECT ... TALLYINGwould only "see" the second — the first would have been processed by the first (higher-priority) counting instruction.
trans-unit.target: 在上面的示例中，如果检查对象是 --ABCDEF----BCDEF-- 则最终计数结果将是C-ABC将增加1，而C-BCDE将仅增加一次；尽管人眼清楚地看到了两个“ BCDE”序列，但是 INSPECT ... TALLYING 只会“看到”第二个-第一个将由第一个（优先级高）计数指令处理。

trans-unit.source: With this option, the program will wait for a pre-configured time for the lock to be released. If the lock is released within the preconfigured wait time, the read will be successful. If the pre-configured wait time expires before the lock is released, the read attempt will be aborted and a 51 file status will be issued.
trans-unit.target: 使用该选项,程序将等待一个预先配置的时间来释放锁。如果锁在预设的等待时间内被释放,读取将成功。如果预设的等待时间在锁被释放前已过,则读取尝试将被中止,并发出51文件状态。

trans-unit.source: You may execute theSUPPRESS(see SUPPRESS) statement to squelch the presentation of the specified report group altogether. Note that you will be suppressing this one specific instance of that group’s presentation and not all of them.
trans-unit.target: 您可以执行 SUPPRESS （请参阅SUPPRESS）语句来完全抑制指定报告组的显示。请注意，您将隐藏该组演示文稿的这一特定实例，而不是全部隐藏。

trans-unit.source: You may not use anENTRYstatement in a nested subprogram, nor may you use it in any form of user-defined function.
trans-unit.target: 您不能在嵌套子程序中使用 ENTRY 语句，也不能以任何形式的用户定义函数使用它。

trans-unit.source: You may only read the existing contents of the file — only theCLOSEREADSTARTandUNLOCKstatements will be allowed. This enforcement takes place at execution time, not compilation time.
trans-unit.target: 您只能读取文件的现有内容-仅允许 CLOSE READ START 和 UNLOCK 语句。这种强制执行发生在执行时，而不是编译时。

trans-unit.source: You may only write new content (which will be appended after the previously existing file contents) to the file — only theCLOSEUNLOCKandWRITEstatements will be allowed. This enforcement takes place at execution time, not compilation time. You cannot extend an empty file; this will not generate a runtime error, but no output will appear in the file.
trans-unit.target: 您只能将新内容（将在先前存在的文件内容之后追加）写入文件中-仅允许 CLOSE UNLOCK 和 WRITE 语句。这种强制执行发生在执行时，而不是编译时。您不能扩展空文件；这不会产生运行时错误，但是文件中不会出现任何输出。

trans-unit.source: You may only write new content (which will completely replace any previous file contents) to the file — only theCLOSEUNLOCKandWRITEstatements will be allowed. This enforcement takes place at execution time, not compilation time.
trans-unit.target: 您只能将新内容（将完全替换任何先前的文件内容）写入文件-仅允许 CLOSE UNLOCK 和 WRITE 语句。这种强制执行发生在执行时，而不是编译时。

trans-unit.source: You may perform any operation you wish against the file — all file I/O statements will be allowed.
trans-unit.target: 您可以对文件执行任何所需的操作-将允许所有文件I / O语句。

trans-unit.source: You may use the>>SOURCECDF directive (see >>SOURCE) to switch to Free Format Mode >>SOURCE FORMAT IS FREE or Fixed Format Mode >>SOURCE FORMAT IS FIXED
trans-unit.target: 您可以使用 >>SOURCE CDF指令（请参阅>> SOURCE）切换到自由格式模式 >>SOURCE FORMAT IS FREE 或固定格式模式 >>SOURCE FORMAT IS FIXED

trans-unit.source: You may use theSOURCEFORMAT AS FIXEDandSOURCEFORMAT AS FREEclauses of the>>SETCDF directive (see >>SET) within your source code to switch to Fixed or Free Format Mode, respectively.
trans-unit.target: 您可以在源代码中使用 >>SET CDF指令（请参见>> SET）的 SOURCEFORMAT AS FIXED 和 SOURCEFORMAT AS FREE 子句分别切换到固定或自由格式模式。
